page.title: 11A WATER BAILIFF'S DAY 2
page.content: IF ANY PERSON IS FOUND USING ILLEGAL FISHING METHODS OR TACKLE ,MUST,UNDER THE SALMON AND FRESHWATER FISHERIES(SCOTLAND) ACT 1951 BE APPREHENDED AND CHARGED AND IT IS THE DUTY OF THE WATER BAILIFF AND THE POLICE TO CARRY OUT THIS TASK. ALSO IT IS THE JOB OF THE WATER BAILIFF TO ISSUE PERMITS TO ANYONE WHO WISHES TO FISH THE RIVER BRORA.HE IS ALSO AN UNOFFICIAL TOURIST GUIDE ANSWERING THE UNENDING BARAGE OF QUESTIONS THROWN AT HIM FROM THE HUNDREDS OF TOURISTS WHO STOP IN BRORA.AT 20.00 A SECOND BAILIFF COMES ON DUTY.THE REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT IS SPENT TRYING TO PREVENT POACHING OF SALMON.AS SALMON FISHING IS A EXTREMELY IMPORTANT MONEY EARNER FOR THE TOURIST INDUSTRY IN SUTHERLAND,THE FISH MUST BE PROTECTED FROM OVER FISHING.
